34YEL0zPo5OrA6QOCfOfFA.text: Fantastic. The happy hour menu is unreal. The value is unbelievable. The food is excellent.

Xe0Mk-P8-9zmhV0HKkN41g.text: Awesome quality! Amazing happy hour! Will definitely be back! Missed it after we left! And was satisfied.  I'm from San Jose ca so I was in search for good California level sushi and was delighted to find a place this good!! My mom was with me and was also satisfied and raging about the food! The chicken teriyaki was amazing!! The unagi nigiri was a great size and tasted amazing. We had a really good waitress, she was generous and took the time to help us and was patient. Her name was Maria! I would definitely recommend this place. Thanks so much Gangnam Sushi (:

MMrs1UMIbinpuwmeW1gHeQ.text: We went for the first time recently and will definitely return. It was awesome!  The waiter was so nice and the environment was comfortable.  We went with the Tempe Roll and the Kiss of Fire(?) don't quote me on that. But it was amazing. The pork gyoza was great too. We can't wait to try more rolls.

e_IWVOHjLS5RCHs2IMP8vg.text: Another hole in the wall. This one looks uninviting and kind of scary from the outside, but please don't let that stop you! The inside is smallish, but very well planned out seating. I had no trouble getting my daughters wheelchair in side. The menu is extensive and the rolls were very good. My only issue was the length of time it took for my son to get his teriyaki Bento box. 45 minutes. By then myself and my other son were done. He let me have a couple of bites and I have to admit that it was seriously tasty. Not too expensive, clean, and very tasty. We'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Las Vegas
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Don&#39;t recall the name

JGGWsGDHfKPyfERzP9H5Ow.text: Really awesome place. Having moved down from Flagstaff where there was only one Korean BBQ joint, I was excited to try out new places. I'm gonna be honest, realizing just how close this was to campus put me off for whatever reason; I was expecting a very limited menu with mediocre food but this was the opposite! I had the bulgogi bibimbap (a dish that I've had many a time and I'm admittedly kind of picky with) and it was really delicious. My sister had a tofu soup and bulgogi and both dishes were really good as well. If you're a student, near campus, or need a bite to eat before catching Pokemon at Tempe Town Lake, I'd definitely stop in here.

Ewyv_3o0yAPTDs2sB39yog.text: The food here is awesome! And the service is great. This is exactly what Tempe needs... a real korean style and sushi restaurant. Great flavor! I had the pro belly tofu pot.. yummmm!!# coming back for sure

QO6hOxRW0nQ38_4WJv81AQ.text: First time in and it was dead around 2pm but I was pleasantly surprised by the ambiance, friendly and attentive staff and the massive portions. Best sushi restaurant near ASU hands down.

NLK5uvMsPNKDk4EdhGehgg.text: Great service and great food! Laura rocks, she helped us navigate our way through the menu, gave us some history on a few of the items used for cooking at the tables. It was nice to have someone guide us through what we were eating instead of dipping into the usually unknown paste. Bring your appetite the portions are big!

Jw8QdQp-79b66Cbd116cng.text: Not bad but as some others have mentioned already this restaurant is a bit overhyped. I do have to say that the interior is really nice and the music selection was great. As for the food it was a mixed bag. I had the Chicken Teriyaki for lunch which comes with salad and miso soup. When the food arrived the waitress asked if I wanted rice which normally would have been included in any other Japanese restaurant? That seemed a bit weird to me to be asked that.  As for the food I thought that the Chicken Teriyaki was decent however the salad was a huge disappointment. They seem to prepare the salad in advance and then leave it in the fridge which makes the salad extremely cold and there even looked to be some frost on there. Also the salad bowl itself was very cold as well, never seen anything like it before. The miso soup was okay I guess, though it was definitely too salty.  I was really hoping that this restaurant would be better as I do enjoy Japanese food and the location is close to where I live. I'll probably give them another chance but so far my first impressions have been somewhat underwhelming.

r-EmyluejBYpu5lsPxTZuQ.text: First of all i'm a huge sushi fan and I have to admit I'm quite disappointed by the lack of good selection there is in Arizona. So when I found this restaurant with all it's great reviews on yelp I had to try it out and see myself. My boyfriend and I were not the least disappointed! Not only was the costumer service spot on, the energy of the restaurant was cozy and comfortable! The pieces were pretty common sushi rolls between 10-14 dollars (average). I got salmon sashimi and two other rolls (will post pics). Everything tasted so fresh and delicious! The rolls were really good sized! Best part? They gave us a complimentary dessert that was crazy good! Everyone who loves sushi needs to try this out! Beware though, we passed the restaurant a couple times. It's a bit tricky to find if you don't know the area. It's on the mini strip connected to the Fed Ex.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Spicy tuna roll, tuna roll, salmon sashimi

sTpNRTDTMmAP0XYTOZfYZw.text: Very authentic Korean bibimbap, amazing bulgogi, freshest sashimi, great service - I just wish they had cucumber kimchi and fresh wasabi... I will be back soon for happy hour! I would give 5 stars but it didn't have much of an ambience. Cheesy decor and no music. Also, skip the Vegas roll.., it's out of place unnecessary with the quality of this place, you don't need a Las Vegas roll. Stay True to what you do well.

wnxR-gAe_p6MJWMhGRTQqg.text: I was looking around for some decent Korean food.  Yelp mentioned this place right down the road from my hotel.  I decided to give it a try.  Like anyone on Yelp, I read the feedback before committing to a restaurant. Reviews seemed very mixed.  I decided to try it out anyways.  I was really disappointed with the quality of their food and the poor level of service I received.  They will not refill your drink unless you specifically ask them or if they decide to ask you.  I was about to try some of their rolls but not even halfway into my meal, I was presented with the bill.  I actually left the establishment still hungry.  My recommendation...stay away from here or you'll end up spending $20 and leaving hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Worst $20 spent

2d5IrhaPcG_JzKuQKIj-JA.text: Fantastic! Dined in - restaurant has a nice atmosphere, wait staff was pleasant and attentive for our entire visit. We ordered a few different nigiri and several rolls - all were presented well, nice portion size for the price (ohmy, nigiri pieces were HUGE!), and delicious. The Mochi ice cream for dessert was the perfect sweet ending to a great meal.

qYDEcI0nE1fqcYyQOHhBoQ.text: Friendly customer service, tasty food, and cool looking ambiance! Not to mention the home made Kimchi! Good place to have both Koran and Japanese food.   Also, they are open on Sunday nights.

QBR-J-h868xRq2fcxjqqow.text: Had a Dragon Roll, spicy tuna and salmon sushi. It was all very fresh and tasty. Good atmosphere and friendly staff. Definitely a place to try and come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

ztSbpJic0iWhwCDWzxnycQ.text: Had the He Dup Bap ... three times in as many days because once wasn't enough!! Great hole in the wall sushi place with Korean & tofu house influences. Will be back next time I'm in Tempe!

BeS-LBWOvQH7le0nYpVKYw.text: I hate giving a low rating for a place with such excellent service. Everyone that works here seems to love their job so much and it shows. Unfortunately, the food isn't great. I first had the bibimbap a few months ago which I thought was decent; unfortunately I've had better. It was a little bland. I had the calamari as well which was undercooked and was awful. I came back recently and had the hamachi kama with ponzu which was okay.

H_dP1sUyU-LoPb4RytNVzQ.text: Solid place. Great variety and everything tastes awesome! Will be coming back! 3 favorites were Fire Jack, Spiderman, and Crazy Monkey. Is a bit small of a place though.

GHuc4ZSdEEeXuuxvhXQ3GQ.text: Sushi rolls were just ok. The  fish was fresh and very tasty. The service was horrible . Sat at the bar chef didn't even acknowledge us . The waitress was slow and unresponsive to problems we were having .

l71cTnpok4U7vQt1P3TPMg.text: Delicious sushi and I must say, at a decent price! Very sweet staff and great atmosphere overall. I would definitely recommend to a friend!

6uv1e2CF5c2I2JCi0vBI4A.text: Worst chicken ever! Where did they buy this chicken? No joke. The chicken tastes like rubber. I can't even think of a grocery store that sells chicken this bad. They definitely went for the cheapest priced chicken they could find.   Sushi is average.

zwZYVTZJzZ35CUVBMD6Q1g.text: This is truly awful sushi and service.  Just terrible.  I'm really not that picky, but the meal was bad from start to finish.  We got a couple of waters.  They had this bizarre plastic taste to them.  We got 4 different kinds of sushi rolls.  All of the fish tasted warm and slightly bad.  The rice was not the consistency it should be for sushi, it was almost mush.  The seaweed wrapping on them was at about the level I was able to achieve when I took 9th grade Japanese in high school a decade ago.  I don't know if they have an unqualified chef but the taste of every component was just bad.  If I wanted grocery store sushi I wouldn't have gone to a restaurant.  Despite there being only two other tables with people and 4 or 5 employees standing around talking, it took us a good couple of minutes to flag someone down for our check.  When we did, they didn't even apply the Happy Hour pricing to it.  We had to flag them down a second time to get it corrected.  Seriously, if you want the gas-station-sushi-in-a-restaurant experience go to Sushi 101.  At least their service is faster.  If you want good sushi, go to Sakebombers 5 minutes down the road.  I would not bother with this place and I look forward to whatever restaurant replaces them.  Bad service, bad food, bad atmosphere, just... a truly disappointing experience.  If you have a date with someone you're not into, this is where I would recommend taking them.

z058oolqQ2WekQEPNWx3lQ.text: Great place! We've been here a few times for sushi before going to tempe imporv to see a comedy show. I love their decor and the colorful wall. The place is clean and comfortable. The sushi is always tasty and their service is fast and everyone is really nice. We'll continue to make this our sushi place whenever we're in the area for the improv.

tXzVZHmLcKQp8JDcy7rPiA.text: As other reviewers have said, it's a small place in a weird strip mall but it did not disappoint! We were really happy with our sushi and the friendly service. My husband had various nigiri and I had vegetable gyoza and two veggie rolls. I definitely would like to return and try their vegetarian bibimbap. Prices were quite reasonable - we will be back!

H1IQdG_PShlSfQ_w78AH0w.text: The Kalbi Hot Plate is to die for! This place never disappoints. I also ordered their Kimchi Stew which has tofu and pork, and it has definitely satisfied my cravings for Korean food. Whenever I am lazy to drive to any restaurants as well, they are also available for Postmates! The ambiance is pretty nice as well, and it is right across from ASU.

PJcsSkc6uIBvvCc--CN7bg.text: One of places that have great rolls. Nearby school, great location.  You should always be there in the happy hours time. It kinda happy hours for most of the time. Whenever I go there, its a happy hours .  I usually have Vegas, spicy tuna, and salmon rolls. I just ask them to remove the crab and unagi sauce due to religious reason. I really like the Vegas roll the most especially when they make it spicy for me! Perfect choice. Last check in I tried potato shrimps, was so good with the sauce it comes with.  One thing I noticed is that when you order a meal and you order it again, for the most time it won't taste exactly the same. I mean it's still good, but little bit different. I had this experience for most of sushi places I tried. I will definitely come bake again for rolls!

_6yRz85oirRL9ZgZGGeXZg.text: This place is our go to for any time away from our toddler around a meal time (or 3 in the afternoon,  you make things work when you have a 2 year old). We always get the bulgogi bibambap with the Korean sides (TIP: Sometimes you need to remind the waiter to bring the Korean sides, but they are supposed to serve them if you have the bibambap). The food is always great and the service is typically fast and friendly.  There is also a happy hour that we are usually there for and the prices are excellent during that time. We get a couple of sushi rolls and a beer or two and those are all on the happy hour menu.

mCOzpK67I6UdUHlXj5Pu_w.text: Enjoyed my meal here before a comedy show across the street but I will point out that there was a lady that either is the owner or the manager that was very unprofessional with her workers, kept on correcting them in front of people and so off putting overall. Plus she does her work on customer tables, you can't find a space in the back?   Anyway, the rest of the staff including the people that she would correct were attentive and kind.  Sushi pieces were huge on top of a small portion of rice. I enjoyed it, the rolls were good as well and didn't fall apart like some places.  Overall I enjoyed this meal except for the older lady that needs some help when talking to someone.

Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Kobe Roll
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Salmon &amp; Tuna

oJUKzvY8TorJfO9fv3e5yA.text: We ordered two bibimbap's from postmates but only received one banchan (we are supposed to get one banchan for each bibimbap). The portion of this one box of banchan is not for two people! We can't ask our postmates driver to get another banchan for us. The menu is already overpriced (we also paid for postmates delivery) and we're not getting what our money is worth... I will never return to this place for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

n7CbNjd0mYojAFpkXAeViQ.text: Close to ASU campus this small sushi restaurant has good food and service. Wide variety of sushi and tempura. Extremely delicious and serves the largest portion sashimi I've ever seen. The reason for only 3 stars is that we had 3 people in our party and they brought out one dish and had to wait 15 minutes more for the sushi, which was the main course for the rest. That is a BIG no no in my book. It can get really loud and you are packed in like sardines. If you like sushi I recommend it, If your looking for a quit place with wonderful ambiance I would avoid.

fOzHmsTXFfsom020Mxxacw.text: LOVED THIS PLACE. They have happy hour at night, I think after 8 pm. My favorite was the deep fried sushi with cream cheese. Their edamame with spicy garlic was also incredible. Would 100% recommend this place and would def come back myself.  Their service wasn't the best...but they were very busy/I guess the food outweighs the negativity of that.

6d7P3P9R6hpAxJjv0lkpxg.text: My wife and I were looking for a specific place for lunch and accidentally came upon this place. Are we glad we did. The first thing I noticed when we stepped inside was the amazing aromas. The restaurant had a nice crowd and everyone appeared to be enjoying their lunch. Emma had the he da bap which is a seafood salad with greens and rice. I had their chicken terriyaki. Emma loved her meal and the terriyaki flavor on my chicken was the best I've ever had. In addition to a great lunch we had equally as good customer service. Can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

0sul3CE9QSK_UjJdHiEaLg.text: this place is a hidden gem. happy hour is where it's at and they have happy hour every day! the service is usually pretty great. and the food comes out fairly quick. i order the vegas roll, california roll, and shrimp tempura roll.

tFR5o-xN1fnwNk9jZG67uA.text: Excellent sushi. Happy hour option is a must. Really good beer price! Great atmosphere with soft Electronic music.

oPXFAD7fVntOTqz4gfvsUw.text: I came here with a large party of friends yesterday for lunch. I ordered the seafood soup combo (I asked for spicy and it was decently spicy! I was surprised to see regular cabbage in the soup) with spicy pork (good size portion for a combo meal). They provided banchan (fish cake, kimchi, bean sprouts, some type of salad, egg and soy daikon).   I'm interested to see what they offer for happy hour. Prices seemed a bit high but the portion sizes were great!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Bulgogi bimbimbop
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Seafood tofu combo with spicy pork and banchan

VhA7iaM8H_SuWHWP0CE_Ew.text: Coming from Southern California, we have a discriminating palate when it comes to sushi. Our close proximity to the Pacific just make us a bit more picky when it comes to Japanese food. Especially sushi.   The sushi in this restaurant is legit. The Korean food (yes indeed) was great too. I had the mackerel and tofu soup combo and the banchan was legit.   I need to come back. Besides, their happy hour prices are reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

pitoEWXfJemzkkVJ5qCCng.text: Their happy hour is awesome! They have something for everybody, and the beer selection is huge. The servers are so kind and attentive. I would recommend this place to anyone, can't wait to come back, AGAIN!!

1Q_En5e0G_QyhEtw7yFYwQ.text: When I moved to Arizona a few years back this was actually one of the first sushi restaurants I have tried and have continued coming back ever since. The sushi here is reasonably priced, they offer great happy hour, and an intimate atmosphere.   Although this is a primarily sushi restaurant they also carry Korean food as well. Although I have never tried it I have heard great things about it and always see guests ordering off of that menu every time I have come in. The sushi has always been delivered in a timely manner and I have always had a positive service experience!  The overall atmosphere is very intimate and friendly and offers a great close to home vibe. I would recommend this place to anyone who is by the ASU Tempe Campus and is craving some affordable sushi/Korean options!

o1-9fYx2BWl9yh-LmO4YCg.text: Nice place.  Pretty busy for a week night. My husband ordered the Bi Bim Bap.  He liked it.  I tried a bit.  I didn't like it. I had the pork belly.   It was cold by the time it arrived.  (10 minutes after my husbands dish had arrived.)  It was just O.K.   The cabbage was delicious.    Nobody came to check on us to see if we needed more beer or water.   There seemed to be lots of staff around, but they didn't  come around.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

-eAe4P6zo5XNCathTSsqRQ.text: I definitely rate it the Best in Tempe. Small hole in the wall restaurant, but so worth it. Fresh rolls and good service. I would recommend this to anyone who loves sushi.

04ciPpOtwko09EcrbTYe-w.text: First time here the food was delicious and the service was excellent. The food came quickly, so if you come hungry this is the place. We went to see the stand up comedy at the improv across the street after dinner, so it was perfect location for quick and casual dinner! Thank you Gangnam Sushi.

u9HrRD0hwkrkGqapsYcI6g.text: Hands down, one of my favorite spots for food.  Portions are great and prices are reasonable. The atmosphere is electric and always lively. The service is always insanely good, and almost overly attentive. The staff will bounce around to all the tables and ensure that everyone is doing well.  The food has been amazing everytime we go, and I recommend you go during happy hour! You can try a variety of things for cheaper!  I would recommend this place to anyone with a mouth.

6mbtbgc6tt3-ItxfiDaQ3w.text: The Japchae was out of this world, but needed a bit more sauce! The takoyaki was amazeballs!

1hBynPZKxQrJUd15pBRmJw.text: I had Chicken Yakisoba here and it was just ok, not great, not bad.  My date had sushi and said pretty much the same thing.  The service is friendly, but it may take you awhile to get some of your food.  All in all, this isn't a bad place, just not one I would return to unless someone really wanted me to.

bTq2BNoWqhCPCZAMy0T6RQ.text: My initial test for real sushi is if they have fresh wasabi or not, and they did!!  Great service and fresh tastes.  Great for a quick bite.  Will return soon!!!

cCk9dAWKUQiFRboEImcP-w.text: Pretty darn good for so close to a major university. Excellent sashimi, really good galbi. Servers seemed a little off, maybe new-ish? Only one of the Korean beers on the menu was actually available though. Very satisfactory for both Korean food and sushi.

c9Tg70QLtE6SKxSLJOLqEg.text: Not often do i get a chance to have real korean food in az. The galbi bibimbap was huge and amazing. I wasnt able to finish it all! My brother got the sushi and the spicy tuna had a pretty decent kick to it. Will definately be coming back here again to try all the other korean dishes

q7S3vEfkeXud2raoRERVfg.text: This place is tempe's secret gem. Definitely my favorite sushi in the east valley and the service is great too. Get the tempe roll!!!!

enkwvMwrrAqrp6IwQFJWZQ.text: I've been here more than a dozen times and I like this restaurant. I don't know if it's authentic, but The Korean food is really great. Service used to be top-notch, but that's suffered a bit. I knocked off a star because the wait can be quite long, and food can be bland on occasion. The staff seems to care, but they are overwhelmed and the service suffers.

_m0e-Br0PCt5OviE1ET_EQ.text: Good, fresh fish. Had Salmon and Yellow Tail nigiri and a couple of rolls. All were delicious. The only thing that could have been better is the rice. It was slightly overcooked and mushy. Service was top notch though.

UDmEzHcxZBdi88Ju5PymOw.text: This place is located in a small strip mall right off of University & Rural Rd.  The inside is very modern and geared towards students.  Service there is really great, and the Korean food is actually on par.  The only complaint is that their ban chan selection is pretty mediocre.  Usually at Korean restaurants you receive a plethora of ban chan, but here, you only receive 3. They have no problem refilling the ban chan for you though...and I didn't pay attention, but I think it's at no additional charge.  They have a combo meal there that I love which you get a choice of a meat/fish and a hot pot of tofu soup. It fills me up every time!  If I lived closer, I'd frequent this place more often and try their sushi.

vOjIpcIvNOxxI_Eeia_Rew.text: What a great place. Very nice clean place with awesome service and even better food. The sushi is some of the best I have had in a while. With a great convenient place for even more ethnic foods!!!

qIO41wRdRPa3MioXJHc-yA.text: I'm glad it's called gangnam sushi and not gangnam kbbq. 20$ for the worst bulgogi I've ever had. Overpriced korean food so I definitely do not recommend any of their korean dishes. Sushi is good tho

Q89JdvFs-NiRTR-QyBI2bg.text: The hype is getting to be a bit too much. My girlfriend and I came here last Tuesday around 4pm and were kept waiting for an hour for our food. When the food came we were only brought a marginal tasting rice bowl rather than the rice bowl and sushi we ordered. Our waitress was new, and everyone kept coming up to us asking if we needed anything and apologizing. It got pretty annoying. Hopefully you get them on a better day than I did.  Opening a restaurant is hard business. You don't know when demand will spike, which makes it tricky to have the appropriate staff and food on hand.   When you make mistakes due to growth in demand you have to apologize and make amends with your customers: good food, comped meal... Nothing was offered.  It might be worth it it might now, roll the dice yelpers and hopefully you will have a better experience and food than me.  Sincerely,  hairy b.

viaFjE6NqXzjVExLjiFDcA.text: The spicy seafood boiling pot was good. But my favorite is the whole mackerel--simply prepared grilled.  We also ordered Omakase B, with 6-7 nigiri sushi (huge portions) as well as a specialty roll. If you are craving both Korean AND Japanese good at the same time, give this place a try. Or, if you change your mind, there is a Thai, a Vietnamese, three Indian,  a Greek, a Mediterranean restaurant in the same plaZa! Plus a hooka lounge (Juba) mixed in with the eating places.

so7qOazVYE_qMKYZaISgHg.text: Went for the Korean food. Great service and clean atmosphere. Hot Pot full of yummy things hit the spot. Really enjoyed our visit

g4ZwrQFNtQotp6gdNDOPTA.text: Alright fellow Yelpers and friends.... This place is brand new and amazing. We found it randomly when searching for sushi on yelp and I am super glad we did.   The location isn't great but honestly, once you try the food, you won't care. It's very authentic and the owner/other staff and family members were awesome. They offer both a Japanese/sushi menu and a Korean menu. We ordered from both. My boyfriend had the bimbimbop (probably spelled this wrong- opps) which is a Korean dish (I'm learning) and I had the Vegas roll and the Tempe roll. Holy moly, delicious. The bimbimbop is served in a hot skillet and is a combination of veggies, Meat and rice. It was perfect! I wish I had taken pictures of all the dishes because they were presented beautifully and tasted even better.   The others in our group had other speciality rolls and everyone raved about how good they were. I think this is my new favorite sushi spot which is saying a lot because I am a loyal customer and already had my go to sushi spot in Scottsdale.  It was that good.   Check this place out, you absolutely won't regret it. Aside from a happy belly, you will receive wonderful service. The owner even waited on us himself!  Oh yeah, try the ice cream!!!! Can't wait to go back to this place!!!

2r30Y4FUEclCxOpNYyvQfA.text: The soup is not very Korean in my point of view. I expect it to be more sour. Maybe I didn't order the right soup.

Jd29k_uAg-wO6xCce4q7YQ.text: Went here with a co-worker for lunch. Get there early and you'll have plenty of seating choices. We got there at 1130 - just before the lunch rush. It was my first time trying the bibimbap and it was delicious! I can't wait to try the other items on the menu.  I would scope out what other diners were getting and it looks like lots of good choices. Will definitely try again.

2jpJhAiBPASHYO2SRY9Psg.text: This was a perfect date night. The food was so good. We shared a bibimbap and one of their fancy rolls -- I think a tiger roll -- and that was enough for just two of us. The bibimbap was huge! That alone would have been at least two meals for me. And the roll came out to be almost a sushi-rrito; it was pretty hefty. The quality was definitely there too. Both of us were very satisfied with our orders as well as the yummy side dishes. That afternoon, the service was excellent too. It might have been because it was an early afternoon dinner, so it wasn't busy enough to lose the attention of the servers. Nonetheless, the servers were really friendly and chatted with us a bit. Everything about Gangnam Sushi and Grill was just very satisfying that day. I hope future visits will be just as nice.

qtr-0F9HmttQScWx1qLDXA.text: As residents of Tempe trying to find a nice sitdown restaurant last Saturday without going all the way to Scottsdale man were we amazed to find this place!!  The atmosphere is modern and clean, the service-exceptional, and cuisine-a delightful array of esthetically pleasing Japanese an authentic Korean that lights up your taste buds!   We decided to go with the bibimbap to start with-a fresh hot Korean dish with great flavor and spicy traditional sauce.  The portion was surprisingly huge so we had to set it off to the side to save room for sushi to come. We were also wowed by the size of the sushi once we saw the beautiful volcano roll, which was "probably the best sushi I've ever had" said my boyfriend after trying it, to which I also agreed. We both have live in Hawaii for years, and find ourselves frequently disappointed by "mainland" sushi restaurants not living up to the famous fresh catch sushi of iron chefs like Morimoto etc. that we had at our fingertips living in the middle of the pacific!   After dinner we got to try the mochi-very good, light dessert option; we got mango and chocolate. Anyways, all in all-it was great and we have now found our new sushi spot!! I must mention again, the wonderful service by all of the staff, even the sushi chef came over and asked how we liked the sushi...and our server held the door on our way out! It was such a comfortable, welcoming atmosphere-like the Asian Cheers! It is so great to see such a good business being introduced into Tempe.  If they keep this up I'm sure they'll be the go-to for many other Tempe dwellers as well! ...their only problem I can foresee might be finding a bigger spot with more tables for patrons once word gets out!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Beef Bibimbap bowl, Waikiki Roll, and Ahi Tower
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mochi Ice Cream

qetINosBEQhxpwVBDVam5Q.text: Everything we had was incredibly delicious and fresh tasting. Since this was our first time here, i didn't know what to expect. We had a roll, bimbop, and katsu don...in each case i would have been extremely sad too see it end of i was not already stuffed. Definitely looking forward to my next visit. When it came to awarding stars, i was looking for a reason to take away some. Nothing came to mind...from the courteous and attentive staff, cleanliness, speed of food preparation, music, atmosphere; to whom ever created this place...well done, well done.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Clay Pot of awesomeness

YphPZQ3wxkdq9G080m07rw.text: Gangnam has really good Korean food (I recommend the soft tofu soup combo). There are better places to go in Tempe for sushi, but it's not bad, especially if you work at ASU and want a break from MU prepackaged sushi.   The kitchen is a bit slow, but the Korean food is so good, it's a draw.   The biggest negative is the service. I've been here multiple times and while the all-male waitstaff shift is great, the all-female shift is a toss-up. Good luck getting the drink you ordered, or any attention after you've gotten your food. Most of the time the servers were standing around talking or looking at their phones, in full view of the dining room, instead of checking on their tables. We had to walk over to them to ask for our drinks (ten minutes after our appetizer had already arrived), to order dessert, and for our check. Once Gangnam brings all of their staff up to par they will get another star.

aGh726UdKmBMogJ_0Ek-Lw.text: A little gem by ASU.   My first time here was an experience. The staff were busy but friendly. We were served by a sweet lady who gave us the 411 on the choices made on my visit. It seemed we chose the favorites: Katsu chicken curry & Spicy pork bibimbop. I must saw, DELICIOUS! I was pleasantly surprised by the flavor. Definitely going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Katsu Chicken Curry
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Spicy pork bibimbop
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

Ziy_P-HHCyjhH0TCmeIVGw.text: I went for a California roll and it was good. The rice was soft and not mushy. I liked that the rice had the proper consistency. I could taste the seaweed and it was the right texture too. I have been to places before where it was difficult to chew through the seaweed. The avocado was the right ripeness as well. Other places have had underripe or overripe avocado in my California roll before. I have also been here before and had the tofu soup. I liked the tofu soup and the sides that came with it.   Anyway, the service was quick and pleasant. I'll have to go back again because the food was good and the servers were nice.  I always forget to check in to restaurant when I visit them. I guess I don't see any reason to do so unless they are offering a check-in deal.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Menu

dUsCTv9r6GEuxsl7OqyMLg.text: Gangnam Sushi is in this random strip mall in Tempe. It's easy to miss. My date got there like fifteen minutes early and ordered for me which I hated because he didn't even get sushi I really liked. The spring rolls were perfectly crispy and I had left over sauce so I dipped the Vegas rolls in it like a glutton and it was great! He ordered a basic crunchy roll and Philly roll so I really wasn't all that impressed. The service was great and you can't go wrong with sake bombs! I think their happy hour is really reasonable.   Date Rating: 1 out of 5, for being slightly catfished. There I am on Bumble and match with Miller. He looks like a bachelorette contestant reject.  Curly blonde hair, pretty smile, washboard abs, and a bio about peace and yoga and whatever. He asks if he can call me and I'm like sure; I love phone calls. We talk about love and relationships and he seems very smart. He asks me out to dinner and I'm like "Hell yeah". Then he asks me to pick him up (lol in what world). I tell him it's more comfortable to just meet there. He texts me 15 minutes before the date that he's there and he's already ordered so I step on the gas.  When I get there, I see he has the worst outfit on and this horrid Civil War style hat. My fingers twitch for my Pinterest app so I can redo his whole aesthetic. We start off with sake bombs and he gets chatty. Apparently he was 39 not 29 and going through some "legal issues" so he wasn't exactly available to leave his house all the time. In the sweetest way possible I tell him what I'm looking for and he says "it seems like you want to be wined and dined. I can't give you that but we can order in and I swear I can give you the sex and emotional connection you're searching for". I could go on a rant about everything wrong with that statement but y'all know, I don't settle. He's going through a very tumultuous time right now and I have no desire to ride shotgun. So I told him it wouldn't exactly work. He says that I was exactly what he wanted and how would I know it wasn't mutual if I didn't give him a shot? Then he looked at me like Cupid had shot him and I got very uncomfortable.   I've never left a restaurant so quickly lmfao. I thanked him for the dinner and deleted his text thread.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

XOcjw3JYVPtdED6egoUmfQ.text: Came here for lunch by myself on a Tuesday. Thought the hostess was a jerk but my sushi was very good and my server was polite. Prices were fair, had the spicy tuna roll and a soda. $12 plus tip. Worth trying again, hope they get rid of their rude greeter at the door.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Spicy Tuna Roll

3Oyj6ZV8FLjTPyLIfFmHuQ.text: I had low expectations ordering sushi from Grubhub in Arizona but when I have a craving, I get bold!  I'm so very glad I did! This was seriously some of the tastiest and fresh sushi I've had in a long time, including some of my favorites from back home (Bay area).  Plus it was delivered to my hotel room while I'm in my jammies. Sometimes I truly am amazed at the priviledge of living in a first world country where sashimi delicacies (tako, ikura, tobiko, and unagi) can be delivered to you in your pajamas.   Feeling full and grateful and I will definitely order from them again the next time I'm in town.  (My only hope is that they will find a more sustainable alternative to the styrofoam that my awesome Waikiki roll came in.)

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Delicious
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Large Asahi
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Menu

QBWNFNbpQCBTwNgaaVifPA.text: Its been a few days, but I felt that I shouldn't forget to give some recognition to our fantastic and funny server, Archer! He was helpful and quick, as well as quick-witted. The food was delicious as I was pleasantly surprised by the salmon salad. Fresh and tasty! We loved the Gangnam roll too. This restaurant is super relaxed and tucked away in a plaza, so be sure to keep an eye out for it!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

Jik16aa2QTLOBk4_DB35Fw.text: We were pleasantly surprised with this restaurant.  Unfortunately have no photos, but we shared 3 rolls and the portion sizes and flavor were good, so was the service.  Will be back.  Great value.

sej3eXiFGVGb7dOUrNZyfQ.text: I hadn't been here in a long time, but I remembered this place existed when I went to my usual sushi spot and saw that it was closed randomly during happy hour. Gangnam's happy hour is fantastic. All their options clearly tell you what prices they are and are cheap, compared to their prices during normal hours. Even though I wasn't very hungry, I chose the Spider roll and the Vegas roll. I can never finished more than one roll in a single seating, but both looked good, so whatever, right?  Both of the rolls came out in 15 minutes. I tried the Vegas roll and it was definitely fresh and hot from the fryer. It was very good, but the Spider roll was definitely the winner. The crab was so, so crispy. I could totally eat that just on it's own.   I finished the two rolls in 20 minutes. A personal record!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Spider roll and Vegas roll

5IXBBEh6W4OgqR8fotwCjg.text: Another great Yelp find. This place was small but didn't disappointment. They had a great selection on their Happy hour menu to include appetizers, sushi rolls, main course options, and drinks.  The food was all awesome. I would say out of everything we ordered I wouldn't get the spicy garlic edamame again. It sounded great but was my least favorite item. Very messy in a red garlic paste of sorts. Okay, just not my favorite.  Sushi was all fresh and tasted great. Very reasonable prices.

zImkDXCv75qPuOPlN5t7nw.text: It's hard finding late-night Asian places expect for Korean food. I can eat Korean food anytime!   The happy hour menu was just perfect for a late dinner and save money from ordering a full plate. They had great tapas selections from the typical sushi, Japchae to kalbi on the menu. You're not paying for the good quality fish when it comes to HH prices. We had about 6 banchans (side dishes). Our waiter was amazing and so attentive always checking our table refiling the banchans and water. Another excellent alternative if you're craving for late-night Asian food in Tempe.

c_haEgTYJPaQtiDSHc51aw.text: So. I have high expectations of sushi places and haven't found some place worth reviewing in the four years I've lived in the Valley. That ended tonight with our dinner excursion to Gangnam. Sure it's a little hole in the wall and has some bro-dudes hanging about, but we walked into a Saturday night happy hour and the best sushi and food!! My spouse isn't a fan of sushi so he ordered some spicy pork, chicken katsu and gyoza. I snuck a few bites and it was delicious!! I had a bunch of nigiri and sampled the calamari and spring rolls. So good!! Fresh cuts-- not skimpy! I can't wait to come back even though it's a hike from where we live!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Nigiri cuts!
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Spicy pork, gyoza and chicken katsu

u-2yDfUn966fZi_kgnkNEw.text: Fist place to have Korean food and I'm Hooked. Bibimbap is delicious. Great sushi. Very fresh.

pFYCpxQptOa3FgedO0tJMg.text: The sushi here was amazing, so was the edamame and the miso soup. It was awesome, so full of flavors. I absolutely love this gem of a place. Please at least give this place a try it's in a weird strip mall area but it's such a great, cute little place.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

CTsn-Bh32VEAZr6t1xTCug.text: Super yummy!! Highly recommending to sushi lovers! They have really good food!! Not just sushi but different varieties! I was so shocked of their menu because there are different kinds!   When you get in the parking lot, it doesn't look nice from the outside but inside is pretty and the menu is just WOW! Planning to come back here again!  We had such a great time here. Service is good. Not bad. Not fast and not slow. They only had one sushi chef so it's understandable. The sushi was just soooo delicious! I was surprised that even though the place isn't so fancy looking BUT the food is 5 Star!   We tried Spicy tuna crunchy roll, Paradise roll, Rainbow roll, Futomaki & Unagi roll. The Futomaki was a very interesting sushi! Something we've never tried before but was very delicious though!   Additionally, Our server was pretty nice & attentive!  Thank you, Gangnam! More people need to know about your business and good. It would be nice if you guys find a bigger place and area so the business will go even further and more people will keep coming!   If I could rate 1000000 stars I would! Thank you again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

z8oyzc0dIDhuy14hOVYG5g.text: Great! I haven't been here in over 2 years, and wow it was even better than I remembered. We ordered two beers and two entrees to share. We meant to get two different types of meat, but accidentally got bulgogi for both. I had no reason to regret that, as the bulgogi was amazing! Such a homey, sweet taste done so well was really refreshing and we blew through both the bibimbap and japjae. My friend who isn't typically a fan of the noodle thought it was great; they were well cooked and the noodle/meat/veggie ratio was really generous. The bibimbap was best after a few minutes of sizzling away. Right when the rice starts to brown and get crunchy - mmmmmm- best bites. We hope to be back soon to try the spicy pork bibimbap :)

Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. bulgogi bibimbap

bpzzkZLgurq49zMjyr1_pA.text: My boyfriend and I loooooove this place! We always try to come when it's happy hour because they have plenty of options for a great price. My fav to eat is the bulgogi, edamame ( with spicy stuff on it), spicy tuna roll, and unagi nigiri! Plus the service is great!

_RYrUITC5Xh2057ERwXqPw.text: Ecliptic little sushi dive. Not fancy, very ma n pa shop, which is what I loved about this place. No frills, just good food.   14 piece sashimi platter was awesome. Tuna (center), white tuna topped with caviar (top), salmon (right), red snapper (bottom) and our favorite...seared albacore tuna (left) topped with green onions and a salt/pepper mix.   Nigiri we had salmon and eel, both excellent (and generous!)!!  Spicy pork was so so. Off the happy hour menu so we weren't expecting much and it was just meh.   Duk Gu, soup with rice cakes, seaweed, eggs and onions was tasty. A little bland but I like salty and my partner likes less, and he thought it was spot on. I'm creating quite the food connoisseur in him.   Like I said, I liked the corner of a strip mall, dive joint appeal set cozily between a hookah lounge and a calzone shop. It fit our mood for a late night snack. Service was ok, little flighty (forgot our drinks, didn't have silverware to eat, etc.) but super kind and laidback.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Salmon and Unagi (eel) nigiri
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. 14 piece sashimi platter
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Spicy pork (happy hour)

saBkgNL_uKSlzXT63oEXJg.text: This is a really good sushi place! Everything is delicious every time I go here! It's super consistent.   Their sushi is fresh and well made. When I mentioned this to the server, they said that they try really hard to have fresh high quality sushi, and I disagree because they don't try, they DO.   Their Korean food is also GOOD. I've had their bibimbap, kimchi pancake, and japchae. All of which, are very good. Also, service is always amazing! Plus, it's close to ASU.   I literally think about this place around 40 hours a week. That's a full time job.   Even a broke college student like me will splurge on their food, so you can bet that they're pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States

24UWzhFp6RvY3CiZnkdPhQ.text: Love their happy hour, especially before we go to Tempe Improv.    Really great service and I don't think you can find a better-priced sushi happy hour anywhere.  We often go with a group and graze on the happy hour menu till we're full.  When you add it up, it's priced about like an all-you-can-eat sushi.  The bento meals are also quite delicious for big appetites.

R9RwkdB7wIaUFoHIXtzpcA.text: This place is a hidden gem!!! My brother took us there and he said you can't order anything bad here. Brandon was our server and he was so great! He was very happy to be there and provided prompt service throughout our meal and helped with great menu recommendations and answered all of our questions.   I had the glass noodles, gyoza, and potato shrimp on the happy hour special. The happy hour specials are freaking amazing! Everything that was ordered at our table was phenomenal!  Super recommend!!!

kO6bbgOEM1o66wkKl6YvQA.text: I did pick up once before and wasn't impressed... And this time I dinned in (sitting at the sushi bar)and still wasn't pleased or impressed by the sushi but what was worse this time after ordering I noticed/was a lil alarmed that the sushi chef was cutting raw meat, which looked like beef... Right in front on me Yuck but what had me worried is he never changed his gloves when making my sushi ,,. All he did is rinse the gloves under water and when done making my sushi went back to cutting the meat ... Honestly I'm A fool for staying but I didn't want to just hop up... I'm. Just hoping I don't get sick ... I've had food poisoning before and it was no joke !!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Raw beef

1L8T3dBqVWvcJto3lagnXA.text: In general the portions are large and the prices are very reasonable. Excellent variety of rolls including some unconventional but delicious combinations. In addition, Gangnam offers many non-sushi options, making it a great place to go get your fix even if your friends don't like sushi. Great happy hour specials, great sushi and awesome bibimbap.

yi6zk8F8wy98KQcsF34CCg.text: Great food but poor customer service. I walked there one evening and showed up 30 minutes before it closed. They refused service and said they were closing early for the night. It was understandable. Then I called to pick up an order over 50 minutes before they would close and they said they had shut down the kitchen for the night. Idk why they have hours when they close an hour before they are supposed to

9Tb-B1-5VTKfj2p1MJVBwQ.text: This sushi restaurant has some excellent sushi with great service. Along with the fact that the sushi is amazing and food comes in a flash there waiters are very nice and respectful. The California roll is my favorite with the perfect combination of ingredients. This is one of the many reasons why I love the food here. It is overall a great place to go and I totally recommend it.

F734xLcJ8FBGkbDSMvDC8g.text: Food is fresh and tastes great. The servers are all very friendly and attentive. The prices are a bit higher than other Korean restaurants, but I don't mind paying a little bit more for quality.   I would recommend coming in for lunch (a bit less pricey). The lunch bento box is a great deal! For 10.95 you get an 8pc California roll, tempura, teriyaki chicken, miso soup, and salad.   +1 from me.

0zJq32-M0XSVbGhU81oBQA.text: I really wanted to like Gangnam Sushi & Grill...And it pains me to give a poor review.  However, the food was horrible.    I ordered steamed pork belly (bossam) and cabbage ($20) and my boyfriend had kimchi soondubu with bulgogi combo ($18).  Everything was extremely salty (and I love salty foods)-- so salty to the point that it was almost inedible.  The service was sub-par, granted it was busy, but it took over 20 minutes to get refills on our drinks and another 15-20 minutes to flag down a server for our checks.    I usually give places a second chance before writing a poor review, but I won't be eating here again.  Bottom line: overpriced, poor service, and poor food. Not worth the hype!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Steamed pork belly and cabbage. Extremely salty and very disappointing.

rBpSwxdu9uRkAd58PjzdLg.text: I am very impressed with the food and service here! I have been here on two occasions. First time I had the bulgogi bibimbap and the second time I had the Katsu Don. The only thing I wasn't a fan of was the salad before the meal. The lettuce was not very green and appeared quite white. I think it may have been iceberg lettuce and I may be a bit biased because I am not a big fan of iceberg lettuce for salad. It was also super tiny and to be honest I can't tell if the dressing had little flavor or if there wasn't enough dressing... because it was quite bland. It could have been a fluke. But wow do I recommend the Bibimbap! It was so yummy! I think the prices are okay. Not super cheap but I looked over the lunch specials and those prices definitely appealed to me. The service was wonderful. On both occasions the servers were so nice, helpful, and attentive. I haven't tried the sushi so I can't speak for that but the meals I had were great aside from the salad. Although I would definitely recommend this place. It's not huge but it's very clean and it has nice decor, friendly service, and good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Katsu Don
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Bulgogi Bibimbap

cc9MvGwrOj7Zkd4jGcMbIg.text: Looking for a place for lunch and I chose this establishment and my son and his mom were extremely happy with my choice! They loved their bento box (spicy pork and teriyaki chicken) and I had the tempura noodle soup and it was just what I wanted. Calamari was simple but really good, our waitress/waiter were really good at checking in on us A+ customer service! We'll be back most definitely!!

pYe-JR5NOi69-6VsyM0ilQ.text: Authentic flavors of food and a great vibe. Awesome customer service!! The bento boxes are a great choice for lots of variety of food. Nice area if you're in the mood for college town as well :) I hope to be back soon

zR5ghd8CUoiOcJaXZk2UmA.text: The chefs choice sushi plate is the best I've ever had. It's worth every penny. 10/10 would order again!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Checks choice platter

UAkRy0vB_A7-hVAGyAyIdQ.text: We went last week on a recommendation from Yelp to celebrate a special occasion, we were not disappointed. It was empty when we walked in around 8:30 pm, but every visible staff member welcomed us in. From beginning to end, everyone was super friendly.  The decor is pretty modern and trendy, nothing too flashy.   They have a Japanese/Korean menu, but we had choose this restaurant to try the teriyaki chicken and sushi.  We ordered sushi and teriyaki combo plate and an entree, we did not expect the portions to be this big.  It was all delicious and we were even given complimentary ice cream!   This is a very nice restaurant.  Large food portions, even the sushi was plentiful, along with some tempura vegetables.  The service is exceptional, everyone was friendly and courteous. I would reccomend.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Desert
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Dinner

Ai9CELCfSN_QRgr9h0CmCg.text: Went here for happy hour today and it was sensational. 10/10 would eat here again. Will be back for sure.

ATHA2ZPHu57TTezwsPqSaA.text: Came here for lunch with a friend the other day.  Their menu is HUGE and has a lot of great lunch specials.  I opted for the sushi because I didn't want a food coma.  Overall, very underwhelmed.  Yes, the sashimi pieces are big but the fish is clearly not high quality.  It looks like it's been sitting out in the air for too long.  The sushi rice was also warm and mushy.  Gross...  I think I'll come again and try their Korean food, because that's what the other tables were all ordering.  Their bimbimbap did look really good!

ZpwoIQyedzqkRvJqAG8t7Q.text: I went here with my boyfriend for a little date night and we were very pleased with our whole experience here. They greeted us nicely and seated us right away. The service was on point and fast.   I ordered Chicken Yakisoba noodles and cucumber rolls, my boyfriend ordered a variety of different sushi's. My noodles were amazing. Great flavor and a good portion size. The cucumber rolls were perfectly sized and had the perfect ratio of rice to cucumber. I didn't try my boyfriends sushi as I don't eat seafood but it looked yummy and he said it was the best he's had around here!   The staff was very friendly.   We will most certainly be going here again! (And again, and again...) I have a feeling it will become a regular spot for us. I would definitely recommend Gangnam! :)

Z6t6f6v7HdlptI88m1vlIA.text: We were looking for a new sushi spot to try and came across Gangnam Sushi. I'm so happy we found this little whole in the wall. The bulgogi was excellent and our sushi rolls were great! We will be back again!

DqEv291ACZEKiJ6v6M5d7w.text: This place is a great little gem in Tempe. Decent and close to authentic Korean tofu soup as you can get in Arizona I imagine. Staff was super friendly and attentive.   Was a great value as this was the cheapest meal we've had while visiting Phoenix/Scottsdale area here with our kids. Definitely a place to try if your are looking for a local place with a different flavor than the usual.

jGlNUbAQJ9HZ4AmDXKQYQg.text: The food was great. It was nice to see both sushi and Korean food on the menu. I would definitely go back. The Korean food was great and just like I remember it from being in LA.

Jg8BVolzaXlJBP1UdV9e1g.text: This place is great.  Hole in the wall location in a strip mall, but the Bimbipbap or whatever, was delish and enough for two to share.  Spicy pork, all kinds of veggies and toppings to add.  Nice service and very nice dining room.  Will be back!

GFOZgJctMg2D-W057mFvNQ.text: This is probably my favorite place for sushi in Arizona; the fish is always fresh and the rolls are reasonably priced. Additionally, happy hour specials will not disappoint. I also love how the restaurant is decorated: lights, Samurai swords, and a bamboo forest. The food from the grill always looks good, but I cannot resist their sushi. I try something different each time and I've enjoyed all of it. Needless to say, I will be returning many times in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Good every time. $5 HH spicy tuna rolls
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Double order of spicy tuna ($5 each)
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Las Vegas and spicy tuna

-aeFqVjzxEcTM3goHT-1hA.text: I've been to this restaurant a few times and have enjoyed the sushi for the most part. I like the more flavorful selections of the rolls, the fish itself if pretty tasty. Looking forward to trying some of the other menu items, they look and smell amazing!

8RBmp6z-WwFpq76Mf7XTXg.text: Second time coming here and the food was as great as I remember! We got the shrimp and pork bibimbap and ate every last bit. The service is awesome and our waiter Charles was very friendly! Would definitely recommend and will be coming back.

mGCs-DkR41Rsp3KlqWging.text: I'm so happy a decent sushi place is within walking distance of ASU. I usually actually get their Korean food - their hu dup bap is really good. I also like they're later hours. This had become go to place for good healthier food when I have a late night working in lab.

owhlLFAHAAV2R-79XRpUaA.text: The interior of the restaurant is really nice and the place is extremely clean. Service was  quick and the food tasted great. Decent prices as well, I will definitely be coming back.

IcpKCrKs6X26klciHFSeMg.text: Great service, portions, and quality fish. Very fresh and the sushi chef knows what he is doing. Will be going back with friends very soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chef special. Only around $20!!!

SV68InRIjAeAK4103MH4JQ.text: I ate there with a friend today. We arrived at about 12:10 pm on a Sat. We had the Kobe Roll, California Roll with Real Crab, Soft Shell Crab Roll (Super Spider Roll?), and the Kalbi. Everything was excellent, and the service was prompt and courteous. Not inexpensive, but much better sushi than I have had for the same prices at other places. I would go here over RA, or Kabuki anytime.

4IwTTUl5-MK5h89IZkrhTA.text: This place is just absolutely amazing! The sushi was absolutely exceptional and the service was without a doubt incredible. The owner, Charles, is a wonderful, charismatic man who's super friendly and kind to all of his customers. I'm definitely coming back!

yqhsWL9qw-jiJRks-qQNeg.text: Sushi was fantastic, and the service was amazing. The wait staff was super friendly and very courteous.  We even got complimentary mochi ice cream... FREE ICE CREAM!  Seriously... Check this place out.

pMaaU-n9AkgBS2JR0RhdGA.text: Amazing food! They are very friendly and prompt. Their sushi rolls are huge and delicious. Definitely recommend it.

vBN8pUHgrgg1ZVZ2sM-_8A.text: Good place for quick delicious sushi dinner. Their nigiri was absolutely delicious.  The large moist pieces of fish were very pretty and inviting and that definitely woke up the taste buds. Small but also very tasty piece of rice was just enough to complement the fish. Tempura department can still use some help. The batter was flat and chewy. In my order the onion ring inside was actually more crunchier than that of the batter. It was supposed to be the other way around. Good atmosphere. Definitely would come back for the nigiri and try the rolls next time.

KVXrkAvRpuAINdhly1IvFw.text: Amazing food and amazing service!! New to eating out alone, and I was so comfortable and super satisfied with the food, but more importantly, the service!! The girls recommended the regular favorites and I could not be more happy I went with their recommendations! The Bulgogi Bibimbap, or any Bibimbap I'm sure, was amazing!!! The red sauce you add on your own was so good!!! Mmm mmm good!!! Very relaxed atmosphere and again, there's no monetary value on great service!! The food is outstanding! I asked the waitress about every plate coming out of the kitchen because I wanted to try everything!! Definitely going back... Waitress recommended the udon noodles (with the chicken and shrimp (tempura)) and the soft tofu soup w bulgogi on the side!! This is a sushi place, yes, but has so much more to offer! I did have a sushi roll, (I know...all that for one person!! BUT, I brought home about 3/4 of the bibimbap), the spicy tuna w avo and the ahi on top, and it was fresh and tasty! I'm super picky and particular with sushi and this tuna was definitely fresh! Hands down, great food and great service!! Do it!! You won't be disappointed!!

Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. OMG!! Amazing... Bulgogi (beef) Bibimbap!! It&#39;s a must! Do it

2DUQRAMyhdAZe0_y7Cz6JQ.text: I had to wait 15 minutes to be served soup. I had to wait 50 minutes for my meal to come. The salmon nigiri was four inches long with so many strands in it that I could not bite off a piece.  The place was loud, crowded and there was not enough wait staff. I never write reviews because I'm an easy-going person; but this place is terrible.

LCRTMtF5QqmClTRNI5R5_w.text: Was misled by previous reviews. Albacore nigiri still had skin on it that I couldn't bite through. Ordered sashimi and received nigiri. Not very impressed. Drink order wrong too.

UE3Q6Vug2aQRQP8NxBKuAw.text: Every roll fell apart. Very little taste. Nice atmosphere, but we've had better sushi in Iowa, believe it or not.

qj-otYvwb-OzXcjmafxE-g.text: OK so I went with some of my friends tonight to this place and figure we do something different than Pho.  As one of my friends got to the place before the rest of us, he requested for a corner table by the window since there was only 4 of us and the host said he can't have that table.  My friend told me that there was only 2 other tables that had customers and the host couldn't even give him that table and instead decide to give us the 6 person table.  Makes no sense at all and disrespect by the host.  Anyway, we all got there and the food was OK as we all ordered the Bulgogi entree and nothing was special about it.  Overall it was an OK experience for dinner as I was not pleased how the host can't oblige a customer's request to have a table by the corner.  I wouldn't go back to this place because of the way how my friend was treated as a customer and this place doesn't have the better food than other places I have tried.  Sorry Gangnam, you have lost yourself 4 customers that won't come back.

eOmX-zs8kWhAGjcyAJfQ6g.text: This place is awesome! The place was packed on a Tuesday night. If that doesn't prove that the food is good I don't know what else will.

CkPpT_k43bIkIdgZQwb4-g.text: Really fantastic food and our server, Jenny, was patient, informed, and charming.  The Salmon Kama and homemade Ponzu was fatty, rich and delicious.  The soups were phenomenal, and the  homemade Kimchi was off the charts good.  Thumbs up!!

CxI6SrtCgW_0BIMsbE0FFA.text: Good food, slow service. Luckily, we weren't in a rush. The bibimbap is definitely big enough for two people. Location is a tad odd - tucked into the corner of a little strip mall. But, good Korean food.

py0loitDbyYbAGeb48t7HQ.text: Went there once,food was great! BUT, the waiter was hitting on me and my friend non stop even tho her bf was right there and he knows thats her bf. Then asked my friend's number the other day outside of the restaurant. CREEPY! And please STOP!

Bm0mqqRFjvCzuzxhuC_YCw.text: Freshest/best sushi we have had in Tempe in a while. Generous servings, stupendous customer service and very nice environment. Highly, highly recommended!!

fPFI5oVaO86230n1pwKlxQ.text: Great sushi place! I'm glad that Tempe finally has a real sushi place to go to! The staff was very friendly too. I would recommend going there to anyone. Best part is that they have green tea ice cream which surprisingly is hard to find at Asian restaurants in Phoenix. Definitely will be coming back.

kigaa3Y_ChJujDzP23ePyg.text: Bulgogi was amazing. It's a korean marinated steak with rice. I have to say it's one of the best dishes I have ever tried. I'm obsessed with it now:)

KaLbWGPv3X1kj9RWgAvqAw.text: This place was cool at first until I received my Tsunami roll with cilantro overpowering any of the other flavors. I asked if they could re-do one with no cilantro or put less in it. They politely said I had to buy a new roll and they would not remake another one...Very disappointing!! Will never come back!!

7FsBQ6t9_vfKqCUaUPFwZg.text: The sushi is what you'd expect; quality is decent and options are plenty. The reason I opt for five stars is because of what is is. It isn't some extravagant or high end sushi bar. It's a family owned, hole-in-the-wall place with kind, genuine staff that serve that decent food at excellent price points. If you want a hole-in-the-wall sushi place, this is a perfect choice.

kCXOhnM66FNZHnr7zgqx4g.text: We went a little earlier on in the evening on a Friday. The atmosphere was a quaint trap house. They music was loud, I'm not a grumpy old man but why so loud?  Service was spotty. It seemed like we had two waitresses helping each other out this lead to more confusion than help though. Just small things all night, forgotten waters, and it took us asking for our bill more than once to final get it.  The redeeming reason they still got 4 stars was the food. We mainly stayed on the happy hour menu. The prices were good and the quality was on point. The kalbi and spicy pork were great! Other in our party went more with the sushi route and everything was great!

rSZTqERYSKyH_feCExs_6g.text: Love the sushi here! My boyfriend and I go at least twice a month. The staff is friendly. We usually go during happy hour, and the happy hour menu has a great selection of sushi. The amount of sushi you get during the happy hour is worth it.

hdCoCpFJS-STy5xIlqWalg.text: Great food for a great price, but the service is awful every time we've come. Great Happy Hour!

1l8Rtv0q_sJPVfWZccc4Ew.text: It's actually been a while since I went here. It was ok but not great. I thought it was expensive for the sushi roll portion sizes. I was disappointed because of all the other great reviews - I'm happy to pay a good amount for decent sushi but I'll stick to sushi places in Mesa instead. Might go back to try other stuff on the menu though.  My favorite go-to is Sushi Kee in Mesa (haven't tried their Tempe location yet)... it's cheap for sushi and not big on atmosphere but the fish is fresh and tasty!

mrazaFuDsQDn9WO1wO4ltw.text: Yum. I absolutely love this place. The parking lot can be a challenge but the sushi is well worth it. I think the pricing is good for their selection. Huge fan of the orange blossom roll! This place has a good atmosphere for a date or catching up with a friend, but if you go at night the lighting is definitely more in the romantic side. Never had anything but good service. I've done to-go orders numerous times and it's ready in 15 mins. Love Gangnam; it's a staple since I moved to Arizona.

lmwPcfZoTYQAtX3eMdFpfA.text: We were craving some Korean food, this time we decided to try a new place for a change. Having seen a good rating of this place, we figured to give it a shot.   We ordered bulgogi and spicy pork totaling at around $44 (pricey for what you get). Both were okay, nothing special. We've had much better. While we usually eat with lettuce wraps, gojujang, and bean paste. Our waiter has no clue what we were asking for. Seems odd as these are normal request we make elsewhere and have never had a problem. This shows lack of knowledge of the food they serve. Disappointing. Management might want to train a bit more in my opinion. Aside from that, service was fine.   Skip. There are other places that taste better and will give you a bang for your buck while you're at it.

Aq0gnRlR5vBoljB5K6IAKg.text: I really like this place but I have to adjust my rating based upon my last couple experiences. One time I ordered to go and they received my order but never prepared it... tonight I placed an order and they told me the price, then I show up and there's a pickup surcharge?  For real?  So they quote me one price on the phone then I show up and the server repeats that price and then says "oh wait forgot about that surcharge". It was $3 so nothing crazy but just a ridiculous experience

DDQOGim6e9Q4ecmKTBhdTA.text: The Japanese here is good, the Korean is better. (Prob because it is Korean owned) I usually like to pop in here quickly for a bite and watch a game on the flat-screens.  After discovering the Hwe Dup Bap here (mixed Korean sushi rice) I don't get anything else. It's a bit pricey at $16 but the value is there with a ton of fish mixed with rice, veggies, and chogochujang (Red Pepper Paste w/ Vinegar). It doesn't look pretty but it sure is a tasty bowl of goodness.  The Japanese side of the menu is decent but I found it not as strong in comparison to the Korean offerings. Sushi is average for the price though the nigiri slices here are quite phat. I couldn't put my finger on it but the sushi rice here falls flat compared to other places and the nigiri comes sans wasabi. Gyoza here is cooked perfectly and worth a try in its perfectly fried glory. Tempura didn't fare as well as the veggies were heavily breaded taking away from the shrimp.  It's pricey but the location and quality Korean keeps me coming back. (7 visits and counting!) Love the ambiance and music.  All in all, Gangnam is a great addition to the other Korean places near campus like Paradise Hawaiian and Grilled Ave.

6lKlKWbp6Js_AY1wiFAEUw.text: I've been coming this place for three years. And unfortunately today will be the last time eating here. The server is a joke. I requested without some ingredients that I can't eat. However it is still, in my bowl. Another ridiculous thing. Two tempura shrimps in the set should come together when they served me the entree. The waitress severed it to me when we asking for the check. Meanwhile, she said:"it's not my fault, it's the chef forget about it." Oh, okay. Here you go, one star for you. I mean, seriously? Are you trying to play with me? I didn't get mad for this, I just don't like the whole experience.

Leuaz32E6GIYnXzCi5GLnQ.text: Great food pretty good service. I had never had bipimbob before so I ordered one with beef and a roll. Big mistake. The roll in of itself was huge for the price and it tasted great the tuna was fresh with a good amount of spice. Then came this massive thing loaded with veggies meat and topped with an egg. If that wasn't enough they brought a great assortment of pickled items to accompany everything, kimchi, fish cakes, bean sprouts omelette, cole slaw. All tasted great as well. We had a great time trying something new the only negative thing I can think of is maybe a forewarning for the massive amount of food they let me order.

JlOJnw52XmnRZVwdjG3D3g.text: Most Sushi restaurants are closed between the hours of 2-5pm, and luckily found this little gem.  And better yet, came in during Happy Hour, which had a lot to choose from for Happy Hour.  Good service, and the mochi ice cream dessert was a nice finish to our sushi fest.

tyG2Pt4KDfUNhG-WAs4RLw.text: I never noticed this place before since it's tucked back in the corner of that shopping center but I saw that it had good yelp reviews so decided to give it a try!  Ordered take out from here for a lunch with friends at my house.  Prices were reasonable and the food was tasty (little more than $50 with tip to feed 5 ladies).  Service was really friendly too.  I only ordered rolls but I'd like to come back and try the nigiri to see how that tastes.

We went because I wanted Pho, but when we saw they had beebimpop (sp?) we had to try it (don't see it on many menus). It did not disappoint. The server was very helpful and patient in helping us choose what we wanted. Terrific experience. Will definitely go back - if we can find it again!

JSQdbtGTRY5fk9YqQZBX1A.text: The portion was small, the price as unbelievable high and the food was not fresh. It seemed like the dishes were sitting there to wait for an order to be placed, then they popped it into the microwave. We ordered the BBQ chicken and bulgogi beef and they were cold and horrible. If you want real Korean food for great quality and better price, Korea Town restaurant in Mesa is the best.

5eHTlUllX9quUveM3mjEkQ.text: Best place to get sushi in Tempe!! Amazing service, nice employees, and great prices. The fish is always fresh and the rolls are absolutely delicious. Can't go wrong with this place!

_1GaYiZbp-BTzpt01EZeRw.text: This was the first time we visited Gangnam and we will definitely be back!  The happy hour menu was great and the service was amazing.  We tried the Sake Bomb roll and were a little disappointed because the salmon was "mushy."  However the roll was good overall.  Saw tons of other things on the menu and being delivered to other tables that looked/smelled delicious.  Nice hidden discovery.

vq5ipsBtGWMRifj2Ngej3Q.text: The bulgogi bibimbap is ABSOLUTELY INSANE!!!!!!!!!! If I had to pick a favorite dish this is it.  If I could only have one for the rest of my life, this is it. It's exploding with flavor and I seriously crave it every single day. My boyfriend and I literally went 2x in one week because it's just that good. We've had the spicy edamame which is great and the salmon nigiri melts in your mouth. Go. Order the bulgogi bibimbap. Do it. Now.

utTFoZtjpsf9XYZnGGazLA.text: Maybe it was just the word Gangnam made me want to come here because it reminded me of that song. So this place is a Japanese/Korean restaurant. I heard the sushi was good and the Korean food was good so I tried it. I liked it. I will have to say that the Korean stuff is more the pricey side while the Japanese food is about what you would find elsewhere.  I ordered sushi and Korean food. The sushi was good. The Korean tofu soup was even better. It had a lot of flavor and way more than the usual ones I find at other Korean restaurant. One thing about the staff is that they are so happy. Why are they so happy? I don't know. But they were happy and enthusiastic. If only they weren't so new and forgetful of things that you request.  Well food and service was good and the decor was very intimate so I say it's good place to bring friends and dates! There's very few Korean places in Tempe so this place is definitely a plus to the area.

mheCZzPdH3PLPEKLCsGeYQ.text: Super yummy, great service and good amount of food for the price.

WEIaCpV9ZVXC_zIyVbQngA.text: If Im  silly for sushi then this place makes me giggle inside!! Carl likes it Gangnam style!! Whoot!

K2f_uwij2PZhTUAIP1yLWg.text: Tucked inside an older shopping plaza and neighboring the Ethiopian restaurant and pho place, Gangnam provides the perfect combination of sushi/Japanese and Korean food in one location. Although the shopping plaza itself is old, the decor of the restaurant is modern and hip, with a sophisticated flair.  We came here around 7 on a Friday night and it was packed! All the tables were occupied but there was still sushi bar seating available. The waiters all greeted us warmly and we decided to wait at the sushi bar area until a table opened up.  Once we procured a table, we browsed through the extensive menu and ordered enough food for a small army (What can I say, my eyes were bigger than my stomach!). We had the super Spiderman roll, bulgolgi bimbimbap, seafood pancake, jap chae, and spicy pork. Our starting banchan was a threesome of kimchi, sprouts, and fish cake.   The roll was huge, and filled with soft shell crab, shrimp, and veggies. The jap chae was excellent, filled with a lot of veggies and very tender, marinated beef. The noodles were cooked perfectly. The bimbimbap was a huge portion, beautifully arranged. I was slightly disappointed that there wasn't more caramelization of the rice on the bottom of the stone bowl. I love the crispy rice bits mixed in with the rest of the rice, veggies, and meat in this dish. The spicy pork was also very tender and flavorful, but not exceedingly spicy. The seafood pancake was good, but could have used a bit more cooking to crisp up the outside for more texture balance.  Service was a bit uneven as it took a long time to actually order, but once our order was placed we were checked on frequently and with very friendly staff.   Overall, this is a great place to dine, and even more alluring since they are open late on Friday and Saturday!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Sushi roll menu
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Spicy pork
Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Jap chae

c7aFHURlBWqDrf1vGYAWTA.text: Tried vegetarian bibimbam and soft tofu soup and it's amazing! The quality of heir food is great and so is the taste.

H2QbNpQFfxT3ORyESXRg6w.text: I find it hard to find great sushi or korean places in Arizona and was interested to see how Gangnam would live up to serving both! The rave reviews on a new establishment was definitely something that needed to be checked out.  The menu here has good variety with a good assortment of rolls, nigiri as well as Korean stews, casseroles and hot stone rice pots (i.e. bibimbap). However, with an appetite on the smaller end I decided to go for their Sake Bomb and an order of Vegetable Tempura.  The dishes come out with sides (banchan) typically served with Korean meals. Though it isn't the full array of 6, the sides consisted of fish cake, potato and Kim Chi. The fish cake and potato aren't the best I've ever had and seemed to be lacking in flavor. I did love the Kim Chi though, it's tart and spiciness was delicious! As for the Sake Bomb, it was a roll laid flat with Salmon, Spicy Tuna and Avocado. The freshness of the fish is okay and I found that their sushi is on the warmer side, not cold slices of fish (finally). However, it isn't amazing. The tempura was large in portion and had a good crust, but typical in flavor.  Pricing is on the pricier side as with most Japanese or Korean restaurants. Sushi roll was about $12 and tempura was about $6.  Judging by the service you can tell that the establishment is new and working out the kinks, however all the servers were genuinely friendly, sought out answers to questions and forewarned that it was their first day. Though a bit spotty in forgetting certain things, they were attentive, refilled waters and made sure to do frequent check ups on customers. The interior is clean and modern.  Definitely would like to come back to try their Korean dishes and to eat more of their amazing Kim Chi!

photos.caption: Photo of Gangnam Sushi & Grill - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mango &amp; Green Tea Mochi

ZdlB4DFuNkVl6SbwaXRq0w.text: They know how to make sushi rice!  This is now our favorite Sushi place in the East Valley!  The salmon nigiri is excellent!  They even make a delicious California roll; which I never thought would be possible!  The Happy Hour is fantastic!    They do Korean food well, too.  But it's the way they make the sushi rice that makes the sushi so flavorful.  The staff is always kind and the food is always fresh and delicious!
